relation: 'Notable Irish Architectural Families, 4: James & George Richard Pain'
pageTitle: Dictionary of Irish Architects - PAIN, JAMES
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {180613=The Dictionary of Irish Architects lists the work and biographies of architects, builders, and craftsmen who were active in Ireland between 1720 and 1940. rev. 31}
textBeforeTable: David Lee & Debbie Jacobs, James Pain, architect (Limerick Civic Trust, 2005), 228-9(illus.) Refs: Cornices, for Gen. Sir Richard Bourke. Nature: ? Date: CO. LIMERICK, THORNFIELD (LISNAGRY) Building: Anna-Maria Hajba, Houses of Cork I (2002), 105(illus.) Refs: 'turreted cut-stone porch designed by James Pain' (Hajba).. Nature: ? Date: CO. CORK, CASTLE KEVIN (KILLAVULLEN) Building: 'Copy of a Design for new front to Johnstown Castle by Pain' by Sandham Symes in collection of William Harvey (a descendant of Sandham Symes), 86 Beechwood Drive, Broomhill, Glasgow; Refs: Proposed new front (3-storey, symmetrical, Gothic, with stepped battlements) Nature: ? Date: CO. WEXFORD, JOHNSTOWN CASTLE Building: NLI MS. 1757 (IAA, Edward McParland files, Acc.
